Can’t upload code?

[phoenix] CANbus Connected: sim
[phoenix] CANbus Network Up: sim
Traceback (most recent call last):
File “C:\Users\jason\t-shirt-bot-1\py\robot\robot.py”, line 339, in
wpilib.run(SpartaBot)
File “C:\Users\jason\AppData\Local\Programs\Python\Python310\lib\site-packages\wpilib_impl\main.py”, line 193, in run
obj = cmd_class(cmdparser)
File “C:\Users\jason\AppData\Local\Programs\Python\Python310\lib\site-packages\pyfrc\mains\cli_sim.py”, line 36, in init
sim_ext_module = entry_point.load()
File “C:\Users\jason\AppData\Local\Programs\Python\Python310\lib\site-packages\pkg_resources_init_.py”, line 2449, in load
self.require(*args, **kwargs)
File “C:\Users\jason\AppData\Local\Programs\Python\Python310\lib\site-packages\pkg_resources_init_.py”, line 2472, in require
items = working_set.resolve(reqs, env, installer, extras=self.extras)
File “C:\Users\jason\AppData\Local\Programs\Python\Python310\lib\site-packages\pkg_resources_init_.py”, line 777, in resolve
raise VersionConflict(dist, req).with_context(dependent_req)
pkg_resources.VersionConflict: (robotpy-hal 2023.2.1.0 (c:\users\jason\appdata\local\programs\python\python310\lib\site-packages), Requirement.parse(‘robotpy-hal<2023.0.0,>=2022.4.1.0’))
[phoenix-diagnostics] Server shutdown cleanly. (dur:0)

[phoenix] Library shutdown cleanly

That’s the message im getting when i try to push code

From just looking at the error, it looks like you have a version of robotpy-hal installed that is incompatible with the requirements you defined. That is, you have version 2023.2.1.0 installed, but have stated that you need a version under 2023.0.0. This could be solved by somehow updating your project requirements or downgrading your version of robotpy.

This should fix it:

pip install -U robotpy[ctre]

If the above doesn’t fix it, you likely have an old package installed that you’re probably not using, e.g. robotpy-commands-v1 from last year.

pip list will tell you what is installed.
